perturbation.original_text:
4. Term of Development Agreement.

4.1. This Agreement shall commence on the date specified in Exhibit "B". Unless terminated pursuant to Section 10 or 11 below, it shall expire upon the earlier of the date specified in Exhibit "B" or upon the opening of the last El Pollo Loco® Restaurant listed in the Development Schedule.
perturbation.changed_text:
4. Term of Development Agreement.

4.1. This Agreement shall commence on the date specified in Exhibit "B". Unless terminated pursuant to Section 10 or 11 below, it shall expire exactly five (5) years from the commencement date, regardless of the date specified in Exhibit "B" or the opening of the last El Pollo Loco® Restaurant listed in the Development Schedule.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text introduces a contradiction regarding the expiration date of the agreement. The original text states that the agreement expires upon the earlier of the date specified in Exhibit B or upon opening of the last restaurant. The changed text stipulates a fixed five-year term, irrespective of Exhibit B or the development schedule, creating uncertainty about the agreement's actual duration and enforcement.

perturbation.original_text:
10. Termination by Developer; Expiration Date.

10.1. This Agreement shall terminate immediately upon El Pollo Loco's receipt of Developer's notice to terminate. In such event, the Development Fee shall be forfeited to Franchisor in consideration of the rights granted in the Territory up to the time of termination. Notwithstanding any provision to the contrary contained herein, unless earlier terminated by either party, this Agreement shall expire on ______, 20___, and all rights of Developer herein shall cease and all unapplied or unused Development Fees paid pursuant to Section 3 hereof shall be forfeited to Franchisor.
perturbation.changed_text:
10. Termination by Developer; Expiration Date.

10.1. This Agreement shall terminate immediately upon Developer providing thirty (30) days written notice to El Pollo Loco. In such event, a pro-rated portion of the Development Fee shall be refunded to Developer, calculated based on the number of restaurants opened versus those planned. Notwithstanding any provision to the contrary contained herein, unless earlier terminated by either party, this Agreement shall expire on ______, 20___, and all rights of Developer herein shall cease and all unapplied or unused Development Fees paid pursuant to Section 3 hereof shall be forfeited to Franchisor.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text creates a contradiction related to the conditions and financial consequences of early termination by the developer. Originally, the development fee is forfeited upon termination by the developer. The modified text states a pro-rated portion will be refunded. This directly conflicts with the original condition, leading to uncertainty about the actual financial responsibilities upon developer-initiated termination and making enforcement unclear.

perturbation.original_text:
18. Applicable Law; Choice of Forum; Waiver of Jury Trial.

18.1. This Agreement, after review by Developer and El Pollo Loco, was accepted in the state in which Franchisor's then-current headquarters (currently the State of California) is located and shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of such state, except that the provisions in Section 20.1 covering competition following the expiration, termination or assignment of this Agreement shall be governed by the laws of the state in which the breach occurs. THE PARTIES AGREE THAT ANY ACTION BROUGHT BY EITHER PARTY AGAINST EACH OTHER IN ANY COURT, WHETHER FEDERAL OR STATE, WILL BE BROUGHT WITHIN THE STATE IN WHICH FRANCHISOR'S HEADQUARTERS (CURRENTLY THE STATE OF CALIFORNIA) IS THEN LOCATED. THE PARTIES HEREBY WAIVE ANY RIGHT TO DEMAND OR HAVE TRIAL BY JURY IN ANY ACTION RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT IN WHICH THE FRANCHISOR IS A PARTY. THE PARTIES CONSENT TO THE EXERCISE OF PERSONAL JURISDICTION OVER THEM BY SUCH COURTS AND TO THE PROPRIETY OF VENUE OF SUCH COURTS FOR THE PURPOSE OF CARRYING OUT THE PROVISION, AND THEY WAIVE ANY OBJECTION THAT THEY WOULD OTHERWISE HAVE TO THE SAME. ANY ACTION BETWEEN DEVELOPER AND FRANCHISOR SHALL INVOLVE ONLY THE INDIVIDUAL CLAIMS OF DEVELOPER AND SHALL NOT INVOLVE ANY CLASS, GROUP, CONSOLIDATED, REPRESENTATIVE OR ASSOCIATIONAL ACTION. NOTHING IN THIS SECTION 18.1 IS INTENDED BY THE PARTIES TO SUBJECT THIS AGREEMENT TO ANY FRANCHISE OR SIMILAR LAW, RULE OR REGULATION TO WHICH THIS AGREEMENT WOULD NOT OTHERWISE BE SUBJECT.
perturbation.changed_text:
18. Applicable Law; Choice of Forum; Waiver of Jury Trial.

18.1. This Agreement, after review by Developer and El Pollo Loco, was accepted in the state in which Developer's principal place of business is located and shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of such state, except that the provisions in Section 20.1 covering competition following the expiration, termination or assignment of this Agreement shall be governed by the laws of the state in which the Developer's restaurant is located. THE PARTIES AGREE THAT ANY ACTION BROUGHT BY EITHER PARTY AGAINST EACH OTHER IN ANY COURT, WHETHER FEDERAL OR STATE, WILL BE BROUGHT WITHIN THE STATE IN WHICH DEVELOPER'S PRINCIPAL PLACE OF BUSINESS IS THEN LOCATED. THE PARTIES HEREBY WAIVE ANY RIGHT TO DEMAND OR HAVE TRIAL BY JURY IN ANY ACTION RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT IN WHICH THE FRANCHISOR IS A PARTY. THE PARTIES CONSENT TO THE EXERCISE OF PERSONAL JURISDICTION OVER THEM BY SUCH COURTS AND TO THE PROPRIETY OF VENUE OF SUCH COURTS FOR THE PURPOSE OF CARRYING OUT THE PROVISION, AND THEY WAIVE ANY OBJECTION THAT THEY WOULD OTHERWISE HAVE TO THE SAME. ANY ACTION BETWEEN DEVELOPER AND FRANCHISOR MAY INVOLVE CLASS, GROUP, CONSOLIDATED, REPRESENTATIVE OR ASSOCIATIONAL ACTION, PROVIDED THAT SUCH ACTION IS IN THE BEST INTEREST OF BOTH THE DEVELOPER AND FRANCHISOR. NOTHING IN THIS SECTION 18.1 IS INTENDED BY THE PARTIES TO SUBJECT THIS AGREEMENT TO ANY FRANCHISE OR SIMILAR LAW, RULE OR REGULATION TO WHICH THIS AGREEMENT WOULD NOT OTHERWISE BE SUBJECT.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text creates a contradiction by switching the governing law and venue from the Franchisor's headquarters to the Developer's principal place of business. The original text states that actions will be brought in the state of the Franchisor's headquarters, but the altered text shifts this to the Developer's location. Additionally, the waiver of class action lawsuits is removed, allowing for class action lawsuits, so long as they benefit both parties, creating uncertainty and potential disputes over which laws and procedures apply and where disputes must be resolved.
